annotation: < non-standard (or historical) form of Javanese; possibly: inherited form with JV semantic interference?
"to acquire something from someone", in extension "to buy something to someone"
"to pay" i.e "to give something in return to something received"

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect

annotation: Means 'to buy' and 'to pay' as well

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: to buy, to sell, to trade - Eng? - JCM
Kava, price; kava-na e-beni, pay for.
The prenasalization is a morphematic feature
Replace, change, pay, go after in revenge
